reviews.review: it was a great way to end the saga.
Loved it! It wraps up some old loose ends and it was great seeing some the former actors/actresses! I found myself getting choked up towards the end!
Some nice action pieces especially towards the end. The plot didnâ€™t always make sense. And the movie was too long.

Wow ! What a fun and beautiful mess !
Lot of great WTF moments. Rey became the Jedi any Star Wars fan always dreamt to see on the big screen.
That movie makes you smile, cry, and laugh.
The last Jedi left us with a sour taste. Rise of Skywalker makes Star Wars fun again.
Good pace, and wrapped up a huge story.

was given the chance to see Rise of the Skywalker, and i gotta say. I started to cry at the end, not cause i was sad. but pure happiness that they finally got it right and did every one justice in the end. I couldint be happier for this final movie in the skywalker story. The last jedi still haunts me, but this movie was down right awesome and had alot of things in it that turned everything upside down for me, and for that in am truly Greatful JJ Abrams i thank you for making things good again. Alot made me doubt this movie, and that it was gonna make everything worse. and i deeply feared it, but i loved it. i Absolutely loved it, and when a movie makes me tear up. then i have to give it 10/10 with super approvel. This was a star wars movie, and a fucking good one!

Rushed plot, retcon after retcon. Character arcs abandoned twisted and he actually changed the significance of a lot of the Prequels and the Original thrilogys themes and diminished Anakins achievement etc. The emperor felt shoehorned in and everything was just poorly excecuted. Horrible writing.
So much better than The Last Jedi.

The plot may be rushed, convenient, and even bizarre, but the less-than-satisfactory set up is more than paid off with some of the best performances, action, and emotion of the entire saga. It would be difficult to call The Rise of Skywalker a well-crafted movie, and yet it manages to capture the essence of Star Wars better than any of the previous Disney-produced installments.

The CGI and special effects were beautiful, but the narrative and pacing just didn't make any sense whatsoever. The dialogue was trite and expected, and many parts of the movie felt like JJ was trying to undo Johnson's work. My disappointment was immeasurable and my evening as ruined.
